com.github.dandelion.core.web.handler

Interface HandlerChain

  • All Superinterfaces:
    Comparable<HandlerChain>
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    AbstractHandlerChain, AssetInjectionPostHandler, CacheHeaderPostHandler, ClearCachePreHandler, ClearStoragePreHandler, DebuggerPostHandler, ETagPostHandler, GzipCompressionPostHandler, ProcessJsPostHandler, ReloadBundlePreHandler, ReportAlertPostHandler, SaveRequestPostHandler

    public interface HandlerChain
extends Comparable<HandlerChain>

    Handler in charge of preprocessing requests or postprocessing server responses.

    Handlers are designed using a slightly modified version of the chain of responsibility pattern:

    • All handlers are grouped in two chains depending on the isAfterChaining() method. In other words, a first chain is in charge of preprocessing requests and another one is in charge of postprocessing responses
    • All handlers are assembled into a chain using their getRank() method
    • Each handler is executed only if the isApplicable(HandlerContext) method returns true
    • Each handler can decide to stop the chain depending on the return value of the doHandle(HandlerContext) method

    If you wish to add a custom handler, you should prefer extending the AbstractHandlerChain instead of implementing this interface.

    Since:
    1.0.0
    Author:
    Thibault Duchateau

      • Methods inherited from interface java.lang.Comparable

        compareTo

    • Method Detail

      • isAfterChaining

        boolean isAfterChaining()
        Returns:
        true if the handler should be executed after the call of the FilterChain.doFilter(javax.servlet.ServletRequest, javax.servlet.ServletResponse) method, false otherwise.

      • getRank

        int getRank()
        Returns:
        the rank of the handler in a chain. A low rank indicates that the handler will be executed first.

      • isApplicable

        boolean isApplicable(HandlerContext context)

        Whether the handler is applicable in the provided context or not.

        Parameters:
        context - The wrapper object holding the context in which a HttpServletRequest is preprocessed or a HttpServletResponse is postprocessed.
        Returns:
        true if the handler can be executed in the context, otherwise false.

      • setNext

        void setNext(HandlerChain nextHandler)

        Sets the next handler to be executed in the chain of responsibility.

        Parameters:
        nextHandler - The next handler to be executed.

      • doHandle

        void doHandle(HandlerContext context)

        Start point of the chain. Handlers are executed depending on the isApplicable(HandlerContext) method and can decide whether the next handler can be executed or not.

        Parameters:
        context - The context in which the handler is executed.
